children.value: is a WebGL object that contains one or more images that all have the same image format. Shaders can read from textures (through a sampler uniform) and they can be set up as render targets (by attaching them to a framebuffer).
base class that implements functionality common to all four types of WebGL:
- Holds 6 textures representing sides of a cube.
(WebGL 2) - Holds a "stack" of textures which enables 3D interpolation.
Note that textures have a lot of optional capabilities made available by extensions, see the Limits section below.
// For ease of use, the `Model` class can bind textures for a draw call
// Alternatively, bind the textures using the `Texture` API directly
A number of read only accessors are available:
- width of one face of the cube map
- height of one face of the cube map
- internal format of the face textures
- type used to create face textures
- data format used to create face textures.
- offset used to create face textures. Always 0, unless specified using WebGL 2 buffer constructor.
- An identifying string that is intended to help debugging.
Sampler parameters can be accessed using
The texture class cannot be constructed directly. It is a base class that provides common methods the the concrete texture classes.
The constructors for these classes should be used to create textures. They constructors all take common parameters, many of which are specified in this document.

    target = this.target,
    pixels = null,
    data = null,
    x = 0,
    y = 0,
    width,
    height,
    level = 0,
    format = GL.RGBA,
    type,
    dataFormat,

    border = 0,

parameters - temporary settings to be applied, can be used to supply pixel store settings.
The following WebGL APIs are called in the function
The following WebGL APIs are called in the function
WebGL allows textures to be created from a number of different data sources.
A texture will be created with the appropriate format, size and width. Bytes will be "uninitialized".
Bytes will be interpreted according to format/type parameters and pixel store parameters.
Bytes will be interpreted according to format/type parameters and pixel store parameters.
image will be used to fill the texture. width and height will be deduced.
video will be played, continously updating the texture. width and height will be deduced.
canvas will be used to fill the texture. width and height will be deduced.
- Used to fill the texture. width and height will be deduced.
If an application wants to store the texture at a certain resolution or in a certain format, it can request the resolution and format with
. WebGL will choose an internal representation with least the internal component sizes, and exactly the component types shown for that format, although it may not match exactly.

WebGL 2 adds sized internal formats which enables the application to request
specific components sizes and types (float and integer formats). While sized formats offer more control, unsized formats do give the GPU freedom to select the most performant internal representation.
sampler reads the red, green and blue components, alpha is 1.0
Red, green, blue and alpha components are sampled from the color buffer.
Each color contains a single luminance value. When sampled, rgb are all set to this luminance, alpha is 1.0.
Each component is a luminance/alpha double. When sampled, rgb are all set to luminance, alpha from component.
Discards the red, green and blue components and reads the alpha component.
red and green components, half float
Color values are encoded to/decoded from sRGB before being written to/read from framebuffer
5 bit red, 6 bit green, 5 bit blue
14 bit floating point RGB, shared exponent
Color values are encoded to/decoded from sRGB before being written to/read from framebuffer
Describes the layout of each color component in memory.
5 red bits, 6 green bits, 5 blue bits
4 red bits, 4 green bits, 4 blue bits, 4 alpha bits
5 red bits, 5 green bits, 5 blue bits, 1 alpha bit

This a simplified table illustrating what combinations of internal formats
work with what data formats and types. Note that luma.gl deduces
by taking the first value from the data format and data type entries in this table.

texture, under WebGL 1 NPOT textures have following limitations.
'Texture' class will perform above settings when NPOT texture resource is created. When un-supported filtering is set using
, those will be overwritten with above supported values (
). This only happens for NPOT textures when using WebGL 1, and a warning log will be printed every time a setting is overwritten.
Textures can be supplied as uniforms to shaders that can sample them using texture coordinates and color pixels accordingly.
Parameters that affect texture sampling can be set on textures or sampler objects.
Textures can be created from a number of different sources, including typed arrays, HTML Images, HTML Canvases, HTML Videos and WebGLBuffers (WebGL 2).
The WebGL Context has global "pixel store" parameters that control how pixel data is laid out, including Y direction, color space etc.
Textures are read from supplied data and written to the specified format/type parameters and pixel store parameters.
